results.title: [Lisinopril: antihypertensive activity, effects on heart rhythm variability and carbohydrate metabolism in patients with metabolic syndrome].
results.text_hl: MATERIAL AND METHODS: Twenty @<m>DISEASE_Metabolic_Syndrome</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D024821 @@@MS@@@ @SPECIES_9606 @@@patients@@@ (13 females and 7 males) received @<m>CHEMICAL_Lisinopril</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D017706 @@@lisinopril@@@ monotherapy for 12 weeks.

results.title: Metabolic and clinical outcomes in nondiabetic individuals with the metabolic syndrome assigned to chlorthalidone, amlodipine, or lisinopril as initial treatment for hypertension: a report from the Antihypertensive and Lipid-Lowering Treatment to Prevent Heart Attack Trial (ALLHAT).
authors: Antihypertensive and Lipid-Lowering Treatment to Prevent Heart Attack Trial
results.text_hl: For those without @<m>DISEASE_Metabolic_Syndrome</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D024821 @@@metabolic syndrome@@@, the rate of newly diagnosed @DISEASE_Diabetes_Mellitus @DISEASE_MESH:D003920 @@@diabetes@@@ was 7.7% for @CHEMICAL_Chlorthalidone @CHEMICAL_MESH:D002752 @@@chlorthalidone@@@, 4.2% for @CHEMICAL_Amlodipine @CHEMICAL_MESH:D017311 @@@amlodipine@@@, and 4.7% for @<m>CHEMICAL_Lisinopril</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D017706 @@@lisinopril@@@ (P < 0.05 for both comparisons).

citations.NLM: Black HR, Davis B, Barzilay J, Nwachuku C, Baimbridge C, Marginean H, Wright JT Jr, Basile J, Wong ND, Whelton P, Dart RA, Thadani U, Antihypertensive and Lipid-Lowering Treatment to Prevent Heart Attack Trial. Metabolic and clinical outcomes in nondiabetic individuals with the metabolic syndrome assigned to chlorthalidone, amlodipine, or lisinopril as initial treatment for hypertension: a report from the Antihypertensive and Lipid-Lowering Treatment to Prevent Heart Attack Trial (ALLHAT). Diabetes Care. 2008 Feb;31(2):353-60. PMID: 18000186

results.title: Comparison of rilmenidine and lisinopril on ambulatory blood pressure and plasma lipid and glucose levels in hypertensive women with metabolic syndrome.
results.text_hl: CONCLUSION: @CHEMICAL_Rilmenidine @CHEMICAL_MESH:D000077769 @@@Rilmenidine@@@ has similar effects on ambulatory BP patterns in @DISEASE_Hypertension @DISEASE_MESH:D006973 @@@hypertensive@@@ @SPECIES_9606 @@@women@@@ with @<m>DISEASE_Metabolic_Syndrome</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D024821 @@@metabolic syndrome@@@ as @<m>CHEMICAL_Lisinopril</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D017706 @@@lisinopril@@@.

citations.NLM: Anichkov DA, Shostak NA, Schastnaya OV. Comparison of rilmenidine and lisinopril on ambulatory blood pressure and plasma lipid and glucose levels in hypertensive women with metabolic syndrome. Curr Med Res Opin. 2005 Jan;21(1):113-9. PMID: 15881482

results.title: Effects of manidipine and its combination with an ACE inhibitor on insulin sensitivity and metabolic, inflammatory and prothrombotic markers in hypertensive patients with metabolic syndrome: the MARCADOR study.
results.text_hl: CONCLUSION: In @SPECIES_9606 @@@patients@@@ with @DISEASE_Hypertension @DISEASE_MESH:D006973 @@@hypertension@@@ and @<m>DISEASE_Metabolic_Syndrome</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D024821 @@@metabolic syndrome@@@, @CHEMICAL_manidipine @CHEMICAL_MESH:C054218 @@@manidipine@@@, both alone and in combination with the ACE inhibitor @<m>CHEMICAL_Lisinopril</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D017706 @@@lisinopril@@@, is significantly superior to @CHEMICAL_Amlodipine @CHEMICAL_MESH:D017311 @@@amlodipine@@@ for improving @GENE_INS @GENE_3630 @@@insulin@@@ sensitivity as well as several metabolic, @DISEASE_Inflammation @DISEASE_MESH:D007249 @@@inflammatory@@@ and prothrombotic markers.

citations.NLM: Martinez-Martin FJ, Macias-Batista A, Comi-Diaz C, Rodriguez-Rosas H, Soriano-Perera P, Pedrianes-Martin P. Effects of manidipine and its combination with an ACE inhibitor on insulin sensitivity and metabolic, inflammatory and prothrombotic markers in hypertensive patients with metabolic syndrome: the MARCADOR study. Clin Drug Investig. 2011;31(3):201-12. PMID: 21155616
